channel.title: CiTR -- Funk My Life
channel.description: Funk My Life grooves out tunes with a bit of soul and a lot of funk, from the birth of rhythm and blues to the golden age of motown, to contemporary dance remixes of classic soul hits. We explore Brasilian funk, Japanese breakbeat anthems, the British motown remix scene, Canadian soul and disco that your parents probably made out to, and the classic originals of American soul music over the past 60 years. Soul in the City's Oker hosts with various guests to bring that extra bounce to your step every Thursday at 11pm.
channel.itunes:summary: Funk My Life grooves out tunes with a bit of soul and a lot of funk, from the birth of rhythm and blues to the golden age of motown, to contemporary dance remixes of classic soul hits. We explore Brasilian funk, Japanese breakbeat anthems, the British motown remix scene, Canadian soul and disco that your parents probably made out to, and the classic originals of American soul music over the past 60 years. Soul in the City's Oker hosts with various guests to bring that extra bounce to your step every Thursday at 11pm.
channel.itunes:author: CiTR 101.9 Vancouver
channel.itunes:subtitle: Funk, Dance, Soul

item.title: Live mix down with DJ Goremay
DJ Shadow's collaboration with Terry Reid, The Caravan from Halifax, and fantastic new A-Skillz mixes.
Housey dancey remixes from Apt One and a throwback all the way to the 60s of the source of Bananarama's Venus.

Back to a house/dance episode chock full of funky remixes from Shapeshifters, Indonesian producer HendraRNRM, a phenomenal Soulmagic remix, with a look into the funky 70s origins of Cassius' I ♥ U So.
A little bit of Soulmagic remixes, Japanese soul-hop, and three decades that You've Got the Love has spanned.
Tabledancers' disco house, Whitest Boy Alive gets the funk treatment, and Gangsta's Paradise in the 18th century.
Folky blues from new artist Cold Specks, Ike and Tina gets remixed, and the French connection to Grace Jones.
Viceroy's edit of Duck Sauce, Fare Soldi's remix of Stevie Wonder, and a bunch of excellent tracks from Blue Sky Black Death's EPs.
Dmitry Bass takes on Chilly, StardonE takes on Michael Jackson, and how Led Zeppelin copied blues musicians for their hits.

A reminiscent listen of Phats & Small's 90s funky house track, the Daniel Bovie & Roy Rox collaboration that's been on loop, and the line that connects Lock Stock & 2 Smoking Barrels to a jazz instrumental track that got transformed into a top 3 hit.

Dimitri from Paris says a little prayer on behalf of Aretha Franklin, Chew Fu and Steve Clisby takes on rock'n'soul, and Maestro talks about victory and defeat because he sticks to his vision to beat the competition.
Can't get enough of DJ Twister, reggae from BabyJ, and a former Beatles takes a little known soul song to the top of the charts.
Chill out funk from Clayton & Fulcrum, incredible new dubstep soul hiphop from The Weeknd, and it turns out Marvin Gaye isn't the original recorder of I Heard It Through the Grapevine.
A nice mix of house and downtempo (now with dubstep!) soul tracks from Alex Metric, Opiuo, Axwell, and Flosstradamus.
Really chill beach house from Pedalpusher, Marvin Gaye remixes and covers galore, and Nancy's Baby wasn't the first to Shoot Her Down.

A great introduction to season two of Funk My Life with contemporary DJs and producers like The Captain, Fuzzbox Inc, DJ Twister, and Wicked Lester working with classic vintage hits and modern continuations of the soul vibe.
Something suave from Ultra Nate, Teddy Pendergrass' appearance on an unlikely compilation, and in my opinion, the best male soul singer ever - it's not Marvin Gaye.
Jazzy soulful hip hop from Vienna's Urbs & Cutex, more Pretty Lights, and a story of how James Brown saved Boston from a firey riot.
Some lovely remixed 1960s R&B from Polish DJ Twister, Marlena Shaw gets a sound makeover from A-Skillz, and the amazing rags to riches story of Etta James and the spinoff tracks she has inspired.

Back on the funky house sound with a Bob Marley mashup, a Curtis Mayfield remix, and talk about the reaction to Amy Winehouse's death through her collaboration with Mark Ronson on the track Valerie, which is actually a cover of another group's single.
Soulful independent hip hop from Youtube uploader Bob42jh, along with hip hop commentary through the Jay-Z/Alicia Keys ballad, Empire State of Mind.
Reggae and hip hop exploration with Fettes Brot, the magnificent RJD2, and The Supremes' promise of Someday We'll Be Together.
Filling in for Aural Tentacles Oker freemix!

Early Massive Attack, saucey Latina La Lupe, and the wonderfully unexpected trail from Mary J. Blige through Kraftwerk to changing American/European music experiments to its influence on modern producers.
Britain-focused show with The Voodoo Trombone Quartet, Engineerz of Soul, and 1960s British invasion with Wild Thing.
Another Adele remix from Keljet, Vancouver's soul men The Funk Hunters, and Blondie and the rocksteady track that went to number one in the US and UK charts and fifteenth in West Germany.
The Captain's new remix of Tom Jones, the Temper Trap remix found on Soundcloud, and a throwback to disco classic Don't Leave Me This Way.
Rebroadcast of electroswing part two. Swedish sensation Movitz, Tim Tim's tropical reggae swing, and the swing classic hit Sing Sing Sing in three of its forms.
funkmylife.com #027 - May 26 2011
item.itunes:subtitle: Back to the best of what we do with an Adele remix, a Tower of Power remix, and a look back at an underrepresented soul family group, Gladys Knight and the Pips.

item.title: Remixed swing music of Louis Armstrong, Ella Fitzgerald, Benny Goodman, and 14 year old Michael Jackson covers the biggest hit of 1951.
Little bit of Diana Ross in her disco days, trippy hip hop sampling from Wax Tailor, and short-lived soul star Tammi Terrell with an official "Messenger of Peace."
funkmylife.com #023 - Apr 7 2011
item.itunes:subtitle: A return to downtempo with Pretty Lights, heartfelt 50s soul with the Originals, and chill dance music with Faze Action.

item.title: funkmylife.com #022 - Mar 31 2011
item.itunes:subtitle: The new favouritest remix of Heard It Through the Grapevine, Coldplay meets the Temptations, and Lady Gaga's Poker Face single and its relationship to a Tunisian folk song that inspired one of hip hop's most notorious terms.

item.title: funkmylife.com #021 - Mar 24 2011
item.itunes:subtitle: Stairway to hip-hop heaven, German DJ Mr. Konfuzed's latin and motown remixes, and a sensational tribute to the late Loleatta Holloway.

item.title: funkmylife.com #020 - Mar 17 2011
item.itunes:subtitle: Yella Finesse demonstrates how French house is an entire genre, an introduction to indie and white label gem Cleptomaniacs, and Little Richard sings the backing vocals for Fergie.

item.title: funkmylife.com #019 - Mar 10 2011
item.itunes:subtitle: Aretha Franklin's little rivalry with Dusty Springfield, beautiful downtempo soul tracks, and a look at the almost-never-happened medley of Tainted Love.

item.title: funkmylife.com #018 - Mar 03 2011
item.itunes:subtitle: We're back to older era sounds with remixed The Mamas and the Papas, Nina Simone meets gentle jazz-house, and Shakira's Waka Waka's origins as a Cameroon military anthem (more like Waka What the... eh eh?).

item.title: funkmylife.com #017 - Feb 17 2011
item.itunes:subtitle: We look at drum and bass remixes of James Brown, Shirley Ellis, and Ray Charles, a remixed Frank Sinatra track by a Toronto artist, and the soul origins of Outkast's single So Clean, So Fresh.

item.title: funkmylife.com #016 - Feb 10 2011
item.itunes:subtitle: French Canadian disco from a Montreal diva, a little bit of disco house for healthier arteries, and Whitney Houston's country music muse.

item.title: funkmylife.com #015 - Feb 03 2011
item.itunes:subtitle: We listen to a Dub Side of the Moon, a reggae cover of Pink Floyd's Dark Side of the Moon from New York's Easy Star All Stars.

item.title: funkmylife.com #014 - Jan 27 2011
item.itunes:subtitle: Some excellent dance tunes from Canadian funky DJs, the nightclub reggae of See-I, and another look at a Duck Sauce remix sampled from disco freaks Final Edition.

item.title: funkmylife.com #013 - Jan 20 2011
item.itunes:subtitle: A relatively new artist called Deekline who's on a production roll, some more Parov Stelar (who now has millions of Youtube views), and an oldie but goodie: The Clapping Song and its origins in advertising for a wheat product.

item.title: funkmylife.com #012 - Jan 13 2011
item.description: We puff up our chest for a remix of Mr Big Stuff, find out why electro-swing is fantastic, and a drum and break look at James Brown!
item.itunes:subtitle: with DJ Oker

item.title: funkmylife.com #011 - Jan 06 2011
item.description: Without doubt the best track to come out of Pincher Creek, Alberta (west of Lethridge), we help ourselves to A Taste of Honey, and what tune is Duck Sauce's Barbara Streisand a shameless copy of? And what tune did that one also copy?

item.title: funkmylife.com #010 - Dec 30 2010
item.description: A look into Bette Davis' Eyes, Stevie Wonder vs wobbly bass, and it's almost 2011 and I'm so excited that I just can't hide it - I'm about to lose my mind and I think I like it.

item.title: funkmylife.com #009 - Dec 23 2010
item.description: Baaaybeh, we love pubescent Stevie Wonder. Tons of reggae remixes and a special tie between Lily Allen's main single and the music of 1960s Jamaica.

item.title: funkmylife.com #008 - Dec 16 2010
item.description: Great instrumental funk, our first heavy electro song, and the original 1968 version of Ready or Not that the Fugees covered.

item.title: funkmylife.com #007 - Dec 09 2010
item.description: Oker has "so much love to give," because it's sampled from The Real Thing!
